summary.p: Various Indic Syllabaries (Devanāgarī, Grantha, Tamoul, Telugu, Tibetan) collected in one bound volume.

18 folios or bifolios of various measurements hinged on tabs, with Arabic library foliation 1–5 and 7–23 (bifolios bear several foliations; folio 6 not foliated), which makes 23 folios, numbered in upper right corner in black pencil (U1). The folios are hinged (montés sur onglet), except f1, which is pasted on the page.
The volume contains, besides the cover and U1, 2 front guard leaves and 2 back guard leaves.

The volume contains 16 items, which are various Indic syllabaries:
Item 1 = Devanāgarī syllabary (f1r), with transcription and French annotation. 1 folio pasted on the volume page = library foliation 1. Incomplete. A series of consonants with a vocalisation only. With Roman transcription of each character. With an annotation, bottom, upside down: Dhatu-pratyaya-pandjica par Dharmakirtti [i.e. Dhātu-pratyaya-pañcikā by Dharmakīrti].
Item 2 = 2 Devanāgarī syllabaries (f2rv). 1 folio hinged on a tab = library foliation 2. One syllabary on recto, the other on verso. f2r: numerals; vowels, initial and medial; consonants series with a vocalisation; conjunct letters, with some corrections in the left margin. f2v: vowels, initial and medial; consonants series with a vocalisation; selection of consonants with u vocalisation; conjunct letters.
Item 3 = Devanāgarī syllabary (f3r), with transcription. 1 folio hinged on a tab = library foliation 3. Selection of consonants and conjunct letters with various vocalisations. With Roman transcription of each character.
Item 4 = Devanāgarī syllabary (f4r), with transcription and French and Latin annotation. 1 folio hinged on a tab = library foliation 4. Consonants series with a vocalisation; initial vowels; selection of 4 letters, with the various possible vocalisations.
Item 5 = Devanāgarī, Grantha and Telugu joint syllabary (f5r), with transcription and French annotation. 1 folio, folded and hinged on a tab = library foliation 5. In the form of tables. For more details, see Colas and Colas-Chauhan (1995, p. 74, n° III), who suggest that the manuscript was sent from Pondicherry by Signard in 1729.
Item 6 = selection of Grantha letters, Tamil numerals, and Tamil symbols for date elements (f7r). 1 bifolio hinged on a tab like a 4-page quire = library foliation 7 only (on page [3]). With a French annotation: Caractères qui servent de chiffres.
Item 7 = Tamil syllabary (f8r), with Latin annotation. 1 folio, folded and hinged on a tab = library foliation 8. In the form of a table.
Item 8 = Tamil syllabary (f9), with partial transcription and French annotation. 1 bifolio hinged on a tab like a 4-page quire = library foliation 9. In the form of tables. “Voyelles initiales” (p. [1]), that is, initial vowels, and consonants (pp. [2]‒[3]).
Item 9 = "Arrangement des Dictionnaires Tamouls" (f10). 1 bifolio hinged on a tab like a 4-page quire = library foliation 10. Notes in French about the alphabetic ordering in a Tamil Portuguese dictionary, that is, an attempt is made to adopt an order which is in agreement with that of the Latin aphabet.
Item 10 = Tamil syllabary (f11r), with Latin annotation. 1 folio hinged on a tab = library foliation 11.
Item 11 = Tamil syllabary (f12rv). 1 folio hinged on a tab = library foliation 12. Initial vowels series; full consonant series with a vocalisation; individual consonant series with various possible vocalisations.
Item 12 = Tamil syllabary (f13) and Telugu syllabary (f14–f16), with transcription (only for Telugu) and French annotations. 2 bifolios hinged on a tab, each like a 4-page quire = library foliation 13–16. In the form of tables. For more details, see Colas & Colas-Chauhan (1995, p. 74–75, n° IX), who state that this was sent from Pondicherry by the Jesuits and identify the hand of Le Gac in one annotation.
Item 13 = Marāṭhī, Grantha, Telugu and Nāgarī joint syllabary (f17rv), with transcription and French annotation. 1 folio hinged on a tab = library foliation 17. In the form of a table. Incomplete: only the column for Telugu is filled-in (initial vowels [f17v] and first consonants [f17r]; thus verso in the volume is in fact the original recto, and vice versa). For more details, see Colas and Colas-Chauhan (1995, p. 75–76, n° X).
Item 14 = Telugu syllabary (f18rv), with transcription and French annotation. 1 folio and hinged on a tab = library foliation 18. For more details, see Colas and Colas-Chauhan (1995, p. 76, n° XI), who state that this was sent from Pondicherry by the Jesuits and copied by Father Gargam (18th c.).
Item 15 = Telugu syllabary (f19r–f22r), with transcription and French annotation. 2 bifolios hinged on tabs; library foliation 19‒22. Initial vowels (f19r), consonant series with a vocalisation (f19r), medial vowels system (f19v), consonants' forms in conjunct letters (f20rv), various conjunct letters (f21rv–f22r). For more details, see Colas and Colas-Chauhan (1995, p. 77–75, n° XII).
Item 16 = Tibetan syllabary (f23r), by Des Hautesrayes (?) with notes in French. 1 folio hinged on a tab = library foliation 23. 1 full page very neatly written, as if for a printed book.
The volume is described in Colas and Colas-Chauhan (1995, pp. 74–77), with further details about the Telugu syllabaries.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (October 2019).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

origin.origDate: Dated to 18th c. by Cabaton (1912, p. 130). Confirmed by Colas and Colas-Chauhan (1995, p. 74ff.) for several of the documents in the volume.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 130, no. 858.
Colas, Gérard and Usha Colas-Chauhan. 1995. Manuscrits Telugu. Catalogue raisonné. Paris: Bibliothèque nationale de France. — See p. 39ff., no. 39.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
